title: Fundamentals of Data Structures
description: Comprehensive study of data structures with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Fundamentals of Algorithms
description: Interdisciplinary approach to algorithms combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Applied Computer Networks
description: Rigorous treatment of computer networks theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Intermediate Data Structures
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in data structures. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Advanced Computer Graphics
description: In-depth analysis of computer graphics principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Artificial Intelligence
description: Advanced exploration of artificial intelligence covering current research and industry practices.

title: Advanced Computer Graphics
description: Advanced exploration of computer graphics covering current research and industry practices.

title: Graduate Programming
description: In-depth analysis of programming principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: ELEC 302 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Machine Learning
description: In-depth analysis of machine learning principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: ELEC 301 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Computer Graphics
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of computer graphics. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: ELEC 333 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Computer Graphics
description: Comprehensive study of computer graphics with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: ELEC 306 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Computer Networks
description: In-depth analysis of computer networks principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: ELEC 369 and senior standing or graduate status
